description: The VCA6 show dives into data center virtualization fundamentals and featuring vSphere 6 as the solution.  It helps the candidate of the VCA6-DCV certification by discussing and demonstrating VMWare’s data center virtualization technology.  The demonstrations and the discussion in each episode go into to identifying the technical requirements for managing the VMWare vSphere 6 environment.  The segments focus on data center challenges and understanding what VMWare products and solutions can be used to meet those requirements.
name: VMware Certified Associate 6 VCA6-DCV
subtitle: Data Center Virtualization

episodes.description: The VCA6 show dives into data center virtualization fundamentals and featuring vSphere 6 as the solution. It helps the candidate of the VCA6-DCV certification by discussing and demonstrating VMWare’s data center virtualization technology. The demonstrations and the discussion in each episode go into to identifying the technical requirements for managing the VMWare vSphere 6 environment. The segments focus on data center challenges and understanding what VMWare products and solutions can be used to meet those requirements.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie walk you through a review of virtualization concepts to prepare you for the VCA6-DCV exam. They begin with the physical hardware and how hypervisors access it. Then they describe the two different types of hypervisors; the Hosted(Type-II) and the Bare-Metal(Type-I). Finally they explore some of the advantages of implementing a virtualized environment.
episodes.title: Review Virtualization Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue their review of virtualization concepts, starting here with the problems that virtualization solves. Next, they discuss what devices can be virtualized and what v-technologies VMware provides for that task. Finally, they show the many benefits of virtualization which includes, availability, scalability, optimization, and management.
episodes.title: Review Virtualization Concepts Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain the benefits Data Center Virtualization. These advantages include lowered cost, maintenance, and space to support your Data Center. It also allows for a highly available environment which increases your business continuity and reducing your downtime.
episodes.title: Explain DCV Benefits

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie discuss some common challenges when managing a datacenter and look at how VMware addresses them. First they look at the different editions of VMware vSphere to familiarize you with them. Then they jump right into datacenter challenges like licensing, scalability, and downtime; explaining VMware's proposed solutions with vSphere.
episodes.title: Understand DCV Challenges

topics.title: Explain Data Center Virtualization Concepts and Identify Typical Data Center Challenges

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain many of the VMware vSphere technologies. They being by explaining the basics of a VMware environment which includes the ESXi hypervisor, the vSphere client, and the vSphere server. Then they look at migration technologies, starting with vMotion. Next they look at VMware's solutions to grant you High Availability and Fault Tolerance. Finally, they show you how the VMware environment can cluster devices and pool resources like storage.
episodes.title: Describe vSphere Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain how to identify vSphere storage technologies. They begin by differentiating between physical and virtual storage as well as the going over some of the benefits of virtual storage. They also look at the High Availability features in vSphere and help you contrast/compare the VMFS and NFS datastores.
episodes.title: Identify vSphere Storage Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue their look at vSphere Storage Technologies; picking up with explaining Thin Provisioning. Then they explore the capabilities of a Virtual Storage Area Network(SAN) appliance and then Virtual Volume capabilities. Finally, they identify the capabilities of Storage I/O control.
episodes.title: Identify vSphere Storage Technologies Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie jump into the exciting world of networking technologies in vSphere. Here they begin by explaining how vSphere connects virtual machines through the Standard and Distributed Virtual Switches. They also introduce you to the virtual switch components, being the Management Plane and the Data Plane. Finally, they look at switch policies and network I/O control.
episodes.title: Identify vSphere Networking Technologies

episodes.description:
Errata:  Ronnie mentions DRS as being Dynamic Resource Scheduler, that is not correct.  It is Distributed Resource Scheduler.  This is an important distinction for the exam please note.    Ronnie was mixing the DPM (Dynamic Power Management) concepts and DRS together, it does happen.
In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie walk you through the different resource management technologies in vSphere. They begin by explaining the concept of resource management with regards to your virtualized environment. Then they briefly touch on vRealize. Next, they jump into explaining the different vMotion technologies; Cross vSwitch, Cross vCenter, Long Distance, and Storage vMotion. Finally, they address Distributed Resource Management, Distributed Power Management, and High Availability.
episodes.title: Identify vSphere Resource Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie take a look at some of the availability technologies and solutions found in vSphere. The begin by explaining the most commonly used availability system which is backups; specifically vSphere Data Protection. Then they discuss vCloud Air Disaster Recovery and Private Cloud Disaster Recovery. Finally then cover vSphere replication requirements and even show you how to configure High Availability.
episodes.title: Identify vSphere Availability Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explore the networking side of VMware by looking at VMware NSX. With NSX you are able to set up a virtualized network of switches, gateways, routers, and even load balancers. Next they focus on exploring the features of vRealize which works to configure operations, monitoring, and alerts, among other things. Finally, they explain the EVO Rack and EVO Rail systems.
episodes.title: Explain DCV Products

topics.title: Identify, Explain and Differentiate VMware vSphere Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Ronnie explore and help to identify various virtual infrastructure objects. They will also explain how to identify and differentiate between different objects statuses and conditions as well as a descriptions of the actions that can be applied different statuses or conditions are identified.
episodes.title: Understand Virtual Object Status

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Ronnie explore the vSphere web interface used to configure ESXi servers. They explain the function of the different client panes, object navigation, the main workspace, filters, access control, tagging and categorization.
episodes.title: Navigate vSphere Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Ronnie discuss the technologies and tools administrators can utilize to monitor hosts running on ESXi. They look at tools like the Client Integration Plugin, how to acquire the plugin and browser support. They also explain the VWWare Remote Console, VMWare tools and how to utilize them.
episodes.title: Monitor ESXi Host and VMs

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Ronnie discuss the various operations that can be performed on a VM through the vSphere Web Client. They explain the different power states of a VM and how to identify these states. They look at the different startup options available for VMs on ESXi.
episodes.title: Perform VM Operations

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Ronnie continue their discussion on the various operations that can be performed on a VM through the vSphere. They will look at vApp operations that can be performed as well as demonstrating operating system installation in Windows and Linux.
episodes.title: Perform VM Operations Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie go over the common business challenges like availability, management, optimization, and scalability; and how to leverage VMware solutions to remediate those issues. They help you discern which solution to use based on business size from small to enterprise.
episodes.title: Apply VMware DCV Solutions

topics.title: Correlate VMware Data Center Virtualization Solutions with Specific Business Challenges
